item.title: The IMF reports that Armenia's economy is improving
item.description:
The International Monetary Fund (IMF) concluded its regular economic assessment of Armenia on June 23, 2017. The IMF noted Armenia’s satisfactory economic growth with controlled inflation, generally well-managed government finances, and increased foreign currency reserves. The IMF observed that in 2016, Armenia’s economic output grew by a minimal 0.2%, prices continued to fall, and the budget deficit reached 5.6% of GDP. However, in 2017, economic activity showed signs of recovery, with a rise in inflation and business loans, supported by relaxed monetary policies...
